data.title: Did the ancient Greek army have any heavy cavalry?
data.meta_description:
Answer (1 of 3): Yes. Alexander the Great's Companions are considered heavy cavalry ie shock cavalry. Macedon is the perfect place to raise horses. The Macedonian Companions were the elite unit. You could say they were proto-cataphracts.

They were armored from head to toe. They carried the xysto...
